Which Oils Are Best For Natural Hair Care?

Otherwise known as Carrier Oils, Natural Oils are a very important part of any Natural Hair regimen and their uses are incredibly extensive. They are brilliant to use as a Hot Oil Treatment and Sealant. These oils can also be added to a Prepoo, Shampoo, Conditioner, Deep Conditioner and Moisturiser to enhance its' benefits to your hair. The list is pretty much endless and if you find one(s) that work best for your hair, you should make sure that it is used in pretty much every part of your regimen.

Below we have listed the top oils you can buy and their unique benefits for your natural hair. They should always be used as a base if you wish to use an Essential Oil. A good ratio is 3 tblp Carrier Oil to 1 drop of Essential Oil.

 

1. VIRGIN COCONUT OIL

Benefits: Coconut Oil is extremely unique. This antibacterial, saturated oil (found solid at room temperature) is the only oil that penetrates the hair strand easily and can be reapplied without causing build up. In addition to this, it also helps strengthen the hair fibre and reinforces the hair shaft from within, simply because it works well with the proteins in the hair. All this goes on while it retains each strand’s moisture content! We forgot to mention it also helps reduce hair porosity! Phew!

Did you know: It’s always advised to use Virgin Coconut Oil because its’ nutrients are purer. They are made from the first pressing of fresh, raw coconut and without the addition of any chemicals. Refined oils are cheaper, but unrefined oils are definitely worth the price.

Uses: It can be added to your deep treatment, conditioner or shampoo, as a pre-poo, sealant and daily moisturizer – and of course, when used as a hot oil treatment.

*Buy Essential Virgin Coconut Oil here!

 

2. ARGAN OIL

Benefits: Commonly referred to as ‘liquid gold’, this organic oil is taken from the kernels of the Argan tree native to Morocco. It boasts of Vitamin E and antioxidants which promotes hair growth and repairing damaged strands. Argan Oil is proven to make hair softer, silkier and adds lustre.

Did you know: Authentic Argan Oil should have some sediment at the bottom of the bottle and appear a bit ‘cloudy’. Also, be weary of the scent smells of absolutely nothing. This shows that the oil may have been deodorized.

Uses: Due to its’ price, Naturals tend to use it sparingly as a sealant and daily moisturiser. However, it can is a wonderful moisturising addition to pre-poos, conditioners, deep treatments and shampoos – and of course, when used as a hot oil treatment or a sealant. Lastly, Argan Oil can help treat split ends due to its richness in omega 3 & 9 fatty acids, and ‘control’ frizzy hair – for want of a better word.

* Buy Arganti Argan Oil here!

 

3. OLIVE OIL

Benefits: Olive Oil definitely delivers when it comes to hair due to its rich, moisturizing properties. Obtained from whole pressing whole olive, this oil can reduce dandruff, split ends and shine to the hair. Rich in vitamins A, E and antioxidants, Olive Oil helps provide strength by protecting keratin in the cuticle.

Did you know: It is always best to purchase Extra Virgin Olive Oil, as it is processed without the use of chemicals and is in its’ purest form. The consistency is quite viscous and is heavier than Coconut Oil.

Uses: In addition, it can help reduce scalp problems thanks to its’ antibacterial and antifungal properties. It works brilliantly in addition to pre-poos, conditioners, deep treatments and shampoos – and of course, when used as a hot oil treatment or a sealant.

 

4. GRAPESEED OIL

Benefits: Pressed from the seed of grapes (especially wine grapes), this light, odourless and non-greasy oil is high in vitamins and minerals. These include Vitamin E, proteins, linoleic acid (a type of Omega 6 fatty acid) and minerals that nourish the hair and scalp. As it is light and is packed with emollients, it easily penetrates, as well as reducing the likelihood of excessive dandruff, breakage and excessive split ends. The consistency is between Olive Oil and Jojoba Oil. (Not to be confused with Rapeseed Oil).

Did you know: As each seed yields a small amount of oil, grapeseed oil is usually extracted chemically. Not great for those who like their products 100% natural, but fabulous for it to be affordable to those who wish to buy it. Some people use Grapeseed Oil as a heat protectant; however we wouldn’t recommend it as even though it can withstand high temperatures, it is not proven to reduce the amount of heat on the hair.

Uses: It proves to be a wonderful addition to pre-poos, conditioners, deep treatments and shampoos – and of course, when used as a hot oil treatment or a sealant.

 

5. AVOCADO OIL

Benefits: This organic oil honestly doesn’t get the attention that it deserves. As the name implies, Avocado Oil is pressed from the fruit of avocados. It contains over 25 amazing nutrients including Vitamins A, B, E and K and minerals such as Copper and Iron. Yes – I know! Its’ high levels of Vitamin E helps promote hair growth, keeps the hair healthy and prevents hair loss. The lightweight formula means all this goodness can be easily absorbed into the hair and scalp.

Did you know: Although it is classed as a vegetable, an avocado is actually a fruit as it has a stone (like mangos).

Uses: It works brilliantly when used added to pre-poos, conditioners, deep treatments – and of course, hot oil treatments or a sealant. Plus, it is great at restoring the health of your scalp if you suffer from dry scalp and/or dandruff.

 

6. AMLA OIL

Benefits: Sourced from the Indian Gooseberry, Amla Oil is traditionally made by placing dried amla fruit in oil (Coconut, Mineral or Sesame Oil). After a few days, the fruit is removed and the oil is purified. Amla oil strengthens the hair follicle and conditions the hair due to its’ essential fatty acids, minerals and vitamins.

Did you know: Some people swear by Amla Oil as a means of delaying premature grey hair.

Uses: Amla Oil can be used to treat dandruff as well as dry, itchy scalps. It tends to have a strong, musky odour, so is advised to be used sparingly and prior to washing/rinsing out. It proves to be a wonderful addition to pre-poos, deep treatments, shampoos and conditioners – and of course, when used as a hot oil treatment or a sealant.

 

7. CASTOR OIL

Benefits: Castor Oil is obtained by pressing the castor bean seeds in its purest form. Packed with Omega-6 Fatty Acids, Vitamin E and its’ anti-bacterial properties to strengthen the hair, it’s no surprise that this oil is extremely popular. It is highly effective for improving the thickness of hair, stimulates hair growth and for treating split ends. The scalp hugely benefits from Castor Oil because it improves blood circulation and removes dry, flaky and itchy skin. It is the thickest of all carrier oils, so typically goes a long way.

Did You Know: Many people believe that the darker the Castor Oil, the less processed it is, but this isn’t the case. Castor Oil that is light yellow has simply been cold pressed (castor beans were squeezed at a high temperature). The only thing is that chemicals can sometimes be used industrially so this could also reduce its purity. Its’ consistency is ‘gloopier’ and somewhat sticker than JBCO. Black Castor simply gets its’ colour by adding ash from roasted castor beans (hence its’ stronger ashy and musty scent).

Uses: It is brilliant when used in addition to pre-poos, deep treatments, shampoos and conditioners – and of course, when used as a hot oil treatment or a sealant.

 

8. SWEET ALMOND OIL

Benefits: A member of the Rosaceae flowering plant family, Sweet Almond Oil is obtained from cold pressing Almond kernels. This organic oil boasts several important nutrients, vitamins and fatty acids. The high Vitamin E content gives it amazing benefits to grow and condition the hair, as well as reducing split ends. It has the amazing ability to penetrate the hair cuticle, so can give essential moisture within. The oil is clear, light yellow and is thinner than other oils e.g. Olive Oil.

Did You Know: Its’ odourless scent is a reason why it is normally used as a base oil for many oil products that some manufacturers claim to only contain another oil on the front (e.g. 100% brand).

Uses: Sweet Almond Oil reduces dry scalp and / or dandruff. It can also be used as a pre-poo and hot oil treatment; on top of a conditioner, deep treatment and of course, a sealant.

 

9. SAFFLOWER OIL

Benefits: Safflower Oil is odourless and colourless. As the name implies, it is made from the extract of Safflower seeds. There are two types of Safflower Oil – one is monosaturated (rich in Oleic acid and suitable for high temps) and the other polyunsaturated (rich in Linoleic acid and must be stored in the fridge). This oil carries more Vitamin E, Omega 3 and 6 than any other oils which all helps replenish and retain the hair’s health. It is brilliant for dry (aka our) hair, nourishes and protects the hair to boot. In addition, it can also be used for hair growth as it prevents the loss of proteins from the hair shaft. Not just through that, it can also widen the blood vessels which results in more nutrients entering the hair follicle – all promoting hair growth. Phew!

Did You Know: It is one of the best secrets in preventing and treating acne due to its linoleic adic.

Uses: It proves to be a wonderful addition to pre-poos, deep treatments, shampoos and conditioners – and of course, when used as a hot oil treatment or a sealant.

 

10. PALM OIL

Benefits: Yes, you read that right. Those of us who grew up with our mums using this in the kitchen will be very familiar with its’ distinctive nutty smell, reddish colour and semi-solid, buttery texture. Palm Oil comes from the fruit of oil palms, mainly in Africa. This saturated oil is solid at room temperature but liquid when melted. It is rich in Vitamin A & E which gives restored strength, health and shine to the hair. All the while, it is easily penetrated into the hair shaft, being able to impart its benefits efficiently. Note: When using, always wear an old t-shirt as it tends to stain.

Did You Know: Many people oppose the use of Palm Oil as it leads to the clearing of forests and death of orang-utans … We thought it best to let you know :/

Uses: Use instead of or on top of a deep treatment or as a hot oil treatment. Trust us!

 

11. JOJOBA OIL

Benefits: Jojoba Oil is the liquid naturally found in the seed of the Jojoba plant. Technically, it is not an oil but a wax ester. Why’s that important? Well, this wax ester is most similar to sebum (the skin’s natural oils) so it can ‘trick’ the skin into thinking it’s produced enough oil, therefore balancing oil production.

Did You Know: This oil is currently being investigated as a possible source of bio fuel.

Uses: Jojoba Oil acts as a great moisturising addition to shampoos, prepoos, conditioners and deep treatments. It is also great for the scalp to prevent dry, flaky scalps and for hot oil treatments.

 

12. NEEM SEED OIL

Benefits: Neem Oil is pressed from the seeds and fruits of the neem (an evergreen tree native in India). Its’ colour varies from golden yellow to bright red and it has a strong nutty odour. Neem Oil is brilliant for encouraging growth and making the hair shiny, strong and silky. It is popularly documented that this oil will treat thinning hair and hair loss. Not just that, it is also brilliant at treating hair lice.

Did You Know: As some people are not a fan of the smell, you can mix it with another carrier oil or add a few drops of essential oil to mask it.

Uses:  Add it to your shampoo, conditioner or deep treatment. You could also use it as a prepoo, hot oil treatment and sealant. Neem Oil is well known for relieving dry and itchy scalp.

 

13. SESEAME SEED OIL

Benefits: As the name implies, Sesame Oil is derived from sesame seeds that has a unique sweet and nutty aroma about it. It has great benefits for the scalp and hair growth due to its nourishing and lubricating properties. Sesame Oil is packed with Vitamin B Complex, E and minerals that strengthens the hair and provides amazing nourishment.

Did You Know: Applying some to your hair and scalp will provide it with protection from UV rays as it is a natural sunscreen!

Uses: Like Neem Oil, Sesame Oil also works as a brilliant treatment against head lice, dandruff and hair loss. To add to its’ amazing benefits, it also is a wonderful addition to pre-poos, deep treatments, shampoos and conditioners – and of course, when used as a hot oil treatment or a sealant.

 

14. SUNFLOWER SEED OIL

Benefits: Simply put, Sunflower Oil derives from – you guessed it – sunflower seeds! According to the Journal of Cosmetic Science, this oil is the second most commonly used oil in hair care products. Due to its high level of Omega 6 fatty acid, it is brilliant at maintaining hair health, preventing hair loss and treating damaged hair.

Did You Know: Sunflower Oil is used as a source of unsaturated fats in the diet to replace unhealthy saturated fats.

Uses: Sunflower Oil acts as a great moisturising addition to shampoos, prepoos, conditioners and deep treatments. It is also great for hot oil treatments or sealant.

 

15. RAPESEED OIL

Benefits: Sometimes called Canola or Vegetable Oil, rapeseed oil derives from the black seed of the rapeseed plant (which produces yellow flowers around Spring). As it is extremely high in Vitamin E, it protects our cells and is a wonderful antioxidant.

Did You Know: Other than linseed oil, it is the only one that is grown and bottled in the UK. It contains half the saturated fat of Olive Oil and has a higher level of Omega 3 than other vegetable oils! Oh, not forgetting it is also high in Omega 6, which promotes and maintains healthy nails, skin and HAIR! Phew!

Uses: Rapeseed Oil acts as a great moisturising addition to shampoos, prepoos, conditioners and deep treatments. It is also great for hot oil treatments and sealants!
